file_content.text: Hyperdrive is ready, and our course is plotted. We'll have you at Karagga's palace in no time!
I look forward to serving with you again.
...Yes, Chancellor, they've just come in.
Karagga refused to talk. He tried to kill us as soon as we arrived.
You can't be serious.
Slimy, murdering filth! We'll blast that palace of his to rubble!
I... doubt that will be necessary. You didn't let Karagga escape, did you?
We had no choice. He wouldn't back down.
It was him or us.
You had to know this might happen.
What did you expect?
He won't be double-crossing anyone else.
That scum had it coming.
We did find one clue: Karagga's personal data key.
Sola, take a look--see if you can use this to access Karagga's systems.
Aye, sir.
Hmm... these maps show outside incursions into Hutt Space from some unknown force. Fifteen in all... they lost a lot of ground.
Then the Cartel attacks weren't simple expansions--they were replacing territory they'd lost to some other enemy.
These attackers may have started with the Hutts, but they could be a threat to anyone--even us.
We could be next.
We've barely scratched the surface of what's happening, Chancellor--I can feel it.
I sense there's more to this.
I suspect you're right, Master Jedi--we need more information, much more.
What's our next move? Gather intel on the Hutts' attackers?
How do we proceed?
They should've stuck with crooked land deals if they wanted more territory.
Didn't work too well, did it?
Karagga's replacement probably will.
None of this excuses Karagga's actions.
The Hutts still had no right.
Of course not. But now we can try to deal with the true threat.
Who cares if the Hutts are getting hit by someone else? We just took down their leader!
Why does it matter?
Anyone who can cause this much trouble for the Hutts could be a threat to us as well. We need to know more.
It's strange... there's no real information on the attackers anywhere in the data. Just a name: the Dread Masters.
Who in blazes are the Dread Masters?
That's all I can find, sir. Whoever they are... they're dangerous. None of the Hutt fleets sent to fight them reported back.
I'll have the SIS investigate immediately--we must learn everything we can about these Dread Masters. Once we do--you'll be the first people I contact.
You can always count on us.
We'll be ready.
Let's hope we give them a better fight than the Hutts did.
Hope we can handle them.
When the time comes, I expect that will depend greatly on you.
We killed the head of the Hutt Cartel. Won't there be fallout?
What about the Cartel?
I expect for now they'll be too busy deciding who should succeed Karagga to give us any problems.
I can't thank you enough. The Republic owes you a tremendous debt.
Stay safe--and be ready for my next call.
Been a pleasure--all of you.
Watch your back.
Captain Hardin?
Come. Let's get on with this.
A few Hutt ships move into the Vyron system--neutral territory--and we're supposed to drop everything and investigate.
Can't say I understand the Chancellor's concern. Hutts are crooks and schemers, not warriors. Not like the Imps.
This crew signed up to smash every Sith-lover from here to the Outer Rim, and instead, we're chasing a pack of glorified bandits.
If the Hutts are a threat to innocent people, they must be stopped--just like the Sith.
We fight against all dangers.
Suppose so. Still--seems we could prioritize a little better.
There seems to be more happening here than mere theft--we have to investigate.
This situation is serious.
I'm not seeing it. But if the Chancellor says "jump"....
We don't pick the ops, we just make them happen.
Orders are orders.
Ought to make that the armed forces' motto.
Absolutely! A beautiful ship like this should be fighting battles, not crime.
Hunting criminals is a waste!
You would say that.
You've got a special mission from the Supreme Chancellor of the Republic--that doesn't happen every day.
You clearly impressed someone.
I'm more interested in what I'm doing than who's telling me to do it.
We didn't come here to listen to your complaints, Captain.
Whine to someone else.
Then I'll spare you.
Tarev, get us moving--objective alpha, Vyron system.
Aye, sir!
Sola, do we have the Chancellor patched in?
Yes, sir--as soon as we drop out of hyperspace, the Chancellor will have a direct link to observe the operation.
My orders were very clear--once we find the Cartel's goons, I just run the ship. You're the ones calling the shots. You ready?
Let's proceed, Captain. And may the Force be with us.
I'm ready.
A Jedi must be prepared for anything.
Always.
Havoc Squad is always ready.
Affirmative.
Must be handy.
Don't worry, Captain. You'll get your baby back in one piece.
This is going to be fun.
Very reassuring.
We're about to find out....
Hopefully.
Are you worried we can't handle this?
You doubt us.
Just don't get us all killed, huh?
Arriving at objective alpha, sir.
Tarev, report!
Multiple Hutt frigates--all with shields and weapons charged. Local defenders are already in retreat--the Hutts are just picking off stragglers. This battle is over, sir.
Hold here. The Chancellor wants us to investigate, not get involved.
We watch from here.
Full stop, Tarev. Shields up, gunnery crews at the ready.
Sir--incoming transmission from the Hutt commander.
Republic warship! You have no business here--this is Hutt Cartel territory! Leave immediately!
Pull us back--we don't want to be seen as hostile.
Back off--don't provoke them.
Pull us around, Tarev--half thrust away. All shields and weapon batteries, align aft.
Sir! Transmission coming in--the Hutts have spotted us.
You made a mistake coming here. Continue your course and leave immediately--this is Hutt Cartel territory.
We're not here for a fight--we just want to know your intentions.
Let's discuss this.
I think you should show a little more respect.
Not very polite. [Warning shot]
Fire a warning shot--show him we mean business.
Primary battery--single volley, across the bow!
Take us in! Engage the Hutts!
Let's go! [Attack]
Tarev, full speed. Primary battery, fire a full volley on the command ship!
Command ship's shields at forty percent, Captain--the others are scrambling to come about.
Incoming transmission from the Hutts!
Stop shooting, you fools! You can't attack us! This is Hutt Cartel territory, you have no right to be here!
We don't want to hurt anyone--we only want to know your intentions.
Let's discuss this.
Just how long has this been Hutt Cartel territory?
Cartel territory?
That isn't important!
We are here to carry out the will of Karagga the Unyielding, Supreme Mogul of the Hutt Cartel!
Keep shooting, Captain. Don't stop until this fool tells us why he's here.
Talk, or you die. [Attack]
Primary battery--another volley!
Enemy shields at five percent.
Are you insane? We're here by the order of Karagga the Unyielding, Supreme Mogul of the Hutt Cartel!
Karagga commanded us to seize this territory, so we have! Now leave!
Captain, take us away from here--we should contact the Chancellor.
Very well.
Tarev, full speed away--but keep the shields up.
Your mission is complete. You can leave this place.
[Force Persuade] You can leave.
My... mission is complete. Let's leave this place!
You've done your work here--you might as well go, too.
Why don't we all leave?
We're not going anywhere!
You're the one who's leaving--Captain?
You first--or else.
All batteries, prepare to fire!
No! No, blast you... all ships! Retreat!
Sola--contact the Chancellor.
I saw everything. It's exactly what I feared--coordinated, Cartel-approved military actions. Karagga the Hutt had better have a good explanation.
Set course for Hutta, Captain--your guests are going to have a word with the head of the Hutt Cartel. I want to know exactly what he's planning.
We won't leave until we've discovered the truth.
Consider it done.
The safety of the Republic depends on it, Master Jedi.
I'm certain we can settle this matter reasonably.
You can count on us.
I wish I had your confidence, Master Jedi.
Are we authorized to use force?
Rules of engagement?
I hope it won't be necessary for you to defend yourselves, but don't hesitate to do so. Otherwise, no aggressive actions.
It's always good to meet important people.
What a business opportunity!
This won't be a business meeting.
Karagga may not be interested in talking. Especially if he actually is planning something.
Why would he tell us?
Refusing to talk to you would be an answer on its own. I won't pull forces from the front lines without more information.
Showing up at the head of the Cartel's palace uninvited sounds like a great way to get killed.
This is suicide.
That's why I can't send normal diplomats. I need someone who won't be trifled with.
Speak to Karagga. Be respectful, but firm--the Republic doesn't need another enemy, but we won't ignore what's happening here.
I'll have my best pilot shuttle you down to Karagga's palace as soon as we're in range of Hutta.
Good luck. And may the Force be with you.
Not now.
